SEARCH
Package ygong.APS

Class Schedule

java.lang.Object
ygong.APS.Schedule
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Schedule>, Iterable<Schedule.MachineWithOrders>
public class Schedule extends Object implements Comparable<Schedule>, Iterable<Schedule.MachineWithOrders>
This class represents a schedule in the APS system. A schedule is a list of Schedule.MachineWithOrders that contains bunch of Schedule.OrderWithTime

A schedule has a grade, which is calculated by the scheduler based on the on-time percentage, makespan percentage, earliest start time percentage, and latest due time percentage. The grade is used to compare schedules and determine the best schedule.

A schedule is used by the scheduler to schedule orders in the production environment. The scheduler generates multiple schedules and selects the best schedule based on the grade.

A schedule is iterable, which means it can be iterated over the list of Schedule.MachineWithOrders in the schedule.

A schedule is comparable, which means it can be compared to other schedules based on the grade. The schedule with the highest grade is considered the best schedule.

Version:
1.0
Note: The schedule is implemented as an ArrayList of Schedule.MachineWithOrders and the grade is calculated based on the on-time percentage, makespan percentage, earliest start time percentage, and latest due time percentage. The grade is used to compare schedules and determine the best schedule.
Author:
Yuyang Gong

    • getMaxMakespan

      public double getMaxMakespan() throws AssertionError
      Calculate the makespan of the schedule
      Returns:
      the max makespan of working machines, which is consider the total work time of the schedule
      Throws:
      AssertionError - if the schedule is empty, there is no need to calculate the max makespan
      See Also:
      • Schedule.MachineWithOrders

    • calcStat

      void calcStat(double min_makespan, int num_orders)
      Calculate the statistics(percentage of violation) of the orders via the schedule
      Parameters:
      min_makespan - the minimum makespan get from the other schedules, used as a baseline (100%) for the stats
      num_orders - the number of orders in the schedule, for now we don't check whether there are depricated orders in the schedule/machines, and we don't hold a number of schedules in Schedule level, we get it from the Scheduler
      See Also:
      • Scheduler.calcAllSchedulesGrade(Integer...)
      • Schedule.OrderWithTime
      • Schedule.Grade

    • calcGradeByWeights

      public Schedule.Grade calcGradeByWeights(int on_time_weight, int makespan_weight, int est_weight, int ldt_weight)
      Calculate the Grade based on the weights and stats calculated before.

      call calcStat(double, int) first to make sure the stats are correctly calculated!

      Parameters:
      on_time_weight - weight for the on time percentage
      makespan_weight - weight for the makespan percentage
      est_weight - weight for the earliest start time percentage
      ldt_weight - weight for the latest due time percentage
      Returns:
      the Grade with percentage
      Note: we can have weights in any kind of size
      See Also:
      • Schedule.Grade.calcGradeByWeights(int, int, int, int)
      • Schedule.Grade
